str2: Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To remember, call to mind, recall, mention. A prolonged form of mnaomai; to remind, i.e. to recall to mind.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From rheo; an utterance, ; by implication, a matter or topic; with a negative naught whatever.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.
Formerly, before. Adverb from pro; prior, sooner.
A cock, rooster. From aleko; a cock or male fowl.
From phone; to emit a sound; by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From apo and arneomai; to deny utterly, i.e. Disown, abstain.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Three times. Adverb from treis; three times.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.
Bitterly. Adverb from pikros; bitterly, i.e. violently.
